titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Heyen Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday March 2, 2019 at 04:00

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by William Heyen in the course of his activities as a poet and editor, and primarily documents Heyen's literary career from 1995 to 2009. Material includes correspondence with poets and writers, writings by Heyen and others, bound copies of Heyen's journals dating from 1965 to 1985, original journals dating from 1994 to 2006, notebooks, printed material, and other papers.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: This finding aid describes a collection that has been acquired by the library in discrete segments over time. The narrative sections of the finding aid provide information about the content and context of the collection. The Collection Contents section provides a general description and in some instances a box or folder listing of the various acquisitions of the collection. The Processing Notes section provides information about the way and extent to which the library has processed this collection. The Arrangement section provides information about how material within this collection is organized and tips on how to locate material across various acquisitions.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from William Heyen on various funds, 2005-2010.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 17 (electronic documents): â€¡a Restricted fragile material. Reference copies available. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The William Heyen Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Heyen Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, titled according to month and year of acquisition. Includes material formerly classed as Uncat MSS 747, Uncat MSS 868, and Uncat MSS 887.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: William Heyen Papers Relating to William B. Ewert (YCAL MSS 235). Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.
William Heyen Papers (MC 71). Milne Special Collections, University of New Hampshire Library.

bioghist.head: William Heyen (b. 1940)
bioghist.p: William Heyen is an American poet and editor. He was born in Brooklyn, New York in 1940, and educated at the State University of New York at Brockton and Ohio University. He taught American literature and creative writing at SUNY Brockport for over thirty years before his retirement in 2000.

His books of poetry include: Erika: Poems of the Holocaust (1984), Crazy Horse in Stillness (1996), Pig Notes and Dumb Music (1998), Diana, Charles, and the Queen (1998), Shoah Train (2003), The Confessions of Doc Williams (2006), and A Poetics of Hiroshima (2008). He edited the collection of poetry September 11, 2001: American Writers Respond (2002).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by William Heyen in the course of his activities as a poet and editor, and primarily documents Heyen's literary career from 1995 to 2009. Material includes correspondence with poets and writers, writings by Heyen and others, bound copies of Heyen's journals dating from 1965 to 1985, original journals dating from 1994 to 2006, notebooks, printed material, and other papers.

Writings by Heyen include typed and manuscript drafts of poems that appeared in Crazy Horse in Stillness (1996), Shoah Train (2003), and A Poetics of Hiroshima (2008), among other works; books annotated with manuscript drafts of poems and notes; and galley proofs of early published works, including Noise in the Trees (1974), Swastika Poems (1977), Long Island Light (1979), that were returned to Heyen when Vanguard Press was sold to Random House. Also included are correspondence and manuscripts relating to September 11, 2001: American Writers Respond (2002), edited by Heyen; and correspondence, manuscripts, and art work stemming from planned collaboration between Heyen and the artist Robert E. Marx.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into four groupings: I. February 2005 Acquisition, 1970-2003. II. May 2006 Acquisition, circa 1950-2006. III. August 2006 Acquisition, 1984-2005. IV. January 2010 Acquisition, 1961-2009.
Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time.

Researchers should note that material within each acquisition overlaps with and/or relates to material found in other acquisitions. For instance, correspondence and writings can be found in all four groupings. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.
Researchers should also note that similar material can be arranged differently in each acquisition, depending on how the material was organized when it was received by the library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into two series: Correspondence and Other Papers, and Writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This portion of the collection consists of correspondence, writings, electronic files, printed ephemera, and other papers by or relating to William Heyen and his writing, including material related to September 11, 2001: American Writers Respond (2002).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains emails, letters, notes, some writings and printed material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into three subseries: Crazy Horse in Stillness , Annotated Books; Other Poetry Drafts; and September 11, 2001: American Writers Respond .

did.unittitle: Crazy Horse in Stillness , annotated books

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes books used by William Heyen for inspiration while writing poems for Crazy Horse in Stillness (1996). Heyen has written out drafts of poems on the flyleaves, margins and on the blank pages of the books. All books are heavily annotated.

did.unittitle: Connell, Evan S. Son of the morning star: Custer and the Little Bighorn (1991)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of several poems, including "Signals" and "Grass."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of several poems, including "Rattle," "Patriot," and "Mother."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: William Heyen read Elizabeth Custer's books for background information while working on Crazy Horse in Stillness . Following the Guidon (1890) and Tenting on the Plains (1895), contain first drafts of poems, including "Echoes," "Decades Later Libbie Remembers the Toads," and "George to Libbie, 1869."

did.unittitle: DeBarthe, Joe. Life and adventures of Frank Grouard (1982)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of about twenty poems, including "Reluctance," "Grouard: The Chickens," "Shadow Memory," "Association of Sensibility," "Geometry," Sitting Bull's Reply," "Fast," "Paunch," and "Ars Poetica."

did.unittitle: Dodge, Richard Irving. Plains of North America and their inhabitants (1989)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of about 25 poems, including "Rock Custer," "Snowbirds," "The Bear," "Wildcat," "Grasshopper Sperm," "Dream," "The White Disease," "Dodge on Deposition," "Earring," Savings Account," "Custer, Around a Civil War Campfire," and "Prospects."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first draft of one or two poems.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of several poems, including "Snuff," "Fusion," and "Looney Tunes."

did.unittitle: Frost, Lawrence A. The Custer Album: A Pictorial Biography of General George A. Custer (1984)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of two or three poems, including "Boots," "1869 Photograph," and "A.D."

did.unittitle: Grant, Bruce. Concise encyclopedia of the American Indian (1989)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first draft of "Feathers."

did.unittitle: Haines, Francis. Buffalo: The Story of American Bison and Their Hunters (1970)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of about 10 poems, including "Here," "5th Avenue," "Wedding Food," "Iron Horse," "Modern Art," and "Super Collider."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of two poems, "The Hunt" and "Medicine."

did.unittitle: Crazy Horse: Sacred Warrior of the Sioux (1989)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of three poems: "Crazy Horse Laughs," "Camera Oscura," and "Short Bull on Photographs of Crazy Horse."

did.unittitle: Hyde, George E. Red Cloud's Folk (1957)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of a few poems, including "Verdi," "Cooper Union," and "After-Image."

did.unittitle: Jones, Douglas C. Court martial of George Armstrong Custer (1976)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of several poems, including "The Paper It's Written On," "The Treaty," and "Blood & Sage."

did.unittitle: Jones, Gene. Where The Wind Blew Free (1967)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of two to three poems, including "Surveyors" and "Heat."

did.unittitle: Kinsley, D. A. Custer: Favor the Bold - A Soldier's Story (1992)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of approximately 15 to 20 poems, including "Hot Battle Cold Shower Custer," "The Keeping," "The Bear," "The American Civil War," "The Animal," "General Sherman to Libbie," "Custer Declines to Sit for a Marble Bust," and "Letter from the Black Hills."

did.unittitle: Matthews, Anne. Where the Buffalo Roam (1992)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of about 6 poems, including "Root Music," "Gene Calves," "The Closing," and "God Does Not Have a Plow."

did.unittitle: Matthiessen, Peter. In the Spirit of Crazy Horse (1983)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of several poems, including "Fuse" and "Awls." William Heyen has credited this book with spurring the Crazy Horse in Stillness poems.

did.unittitle: Miller, David Humphreys. Custer's Fall: the Native American Side of the Story (1992)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of several poems, including "Coffee," "Directions," and "Tom Custer."

did.unittitle: Moeller, Bill and Jan. Crazy Horse: His Life, His Lands - A Photographic Biography (1987)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of poems, including "Horns," "In this Dimension," and "Wingdust."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of approximately a dozen poems, including "Shoals," "Timewarp," "Thought," "Evening Heart Angel Ascension," "Live Oaks," and "V."

did.unittitle: Red Fox, Chief. The Memoirs of Chief Red Fox (1971)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of a poems, including "Breasts" and "In 1905 Crazy Horse Visits the Steamship Nebraska."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of about 10 poems, including "Oriole," "Attack on Fort Union," "Lakota Challenge...," "Government Policy, 1870," and "Custer Ozymandias."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by title of work. Notebooks are arranged as a group at the end of the subseries.

did.unittitle: Rope: poems of Crazy Horse & Custer; The river of electricity; The confessions of Doc Williams
On an Injunction by Theodor Adorno: Holocaust

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of correspondence and manuscripts, relating to September 11, 2001: American Writers Respond (2002), edited by William Heyen. Included are several hundred letters and manuscripts compiled over the three-month period after September 11, 2001, in which the book took shape. Also included are rejected submissions and correspondence with authors who declined to be part of the project.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note by Heyen on inside flyleaf reads: "This notebook contains drafts of many Holocaust poems including 'Art' & 'The Maggots Speak' & 'Religion,' [these three poems to appear in American Poetry Review], many of The Orphanage poemlets, many sections of the Straight Suite for Frank O'Hara, and of many miscallaneous poems."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note by Heyen on inside flyleaf reads: "This notebook contains drafts of dozens of the poems for The Football Corporations; also of 'Skunk Years,' 'After Sept. 11: Wall Street,' 'Shoah Goat,' 'Dr. Heim,' 'Sunlight,' 'Two Young Men,' 'The Devil's Ballad;' also the drafts of a few new 'pig notes.'" Several of these poems appeared in A Poetics of Hiroshima . Also included are drafts of "Museum Visitor Coda" and "To William Merwin."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note by Heyen on inside flyleaf reads: "This notebook contains drafts of the pignote 'Art,' the bookstore poem, some poems toward The Football Corporations, 'From the Fields,' 'Family Dream,' hundreds of poems toward The Orphanage, 'Classmate,' 'Cage,' drafts of Village Board pieces including the one on the letter that was not a letter published locally, the suite of Yankee poems, 'Pitch' & 'Speak, Memory' that went into A Poetics of Hiroshima, the pig note 'Oxymoron,' and much more."

scopecontent.p: This book contains the 1st draft of "Sycamore," which appears in Pig Notes and Dumb Music (1998), and the draft of another piece that I might look at again. Also contains the first draft of "Fana Al-Fana" which William B. Ewert published as a broadside and which later appeared in The Confessions of Doc Williams and Other Poems (2006).

did.unittitle: Greenspan, Henry. On Listening to Holocaust Survivors: Recounting and Life History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains a poem titled, "Dachau Tourists."

did.unittitle: Gribbin, John. Hothouse Earth: The Greenhouse Effect and Gaia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains a draft of "Varves" on p. 55 and back flyleaf.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The back flyleaf of this volume contains the first draft of Heyen's poem that became "ID," included in Shoah Train .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains stanzas (pp. 9-10) of an untitled poem and an inlaid letter from James Hatley.

did.unittitle: Herrigel, Eugen. Zen in the Art of Archery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains a draft of a "classroom poem" on back flyleaf, which Heyen calls, "Zen exercise," and an inlaid sheet of manuscript.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page 58 of this book contains the first draft of a poem titled "Basketball Coach."

did.unittitle: Jones, Richard. Ed. Poetry and Politics

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains an unfinished poem on page 137. A course syllabus for a 1985 poetry workshop has been laid in.

did.unittitle: Karst, Georg M. The Beasts of the Earth

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first draft of the second section of "Three Relations," which appeared in Erika .

did.unittitle: Keeble, John. Out of the Channel: The Exxon Valdez Oil Spill in Prince William Sound

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains drafts of sections of what became "Losing Season," a poem which appeared in Cincinnati Review and was then abbreviated for The Rope (2003). The back inside cover also contains a poem titled, "The Device."

did.unittitle: Klemperer, Victor. I Will Bear Witness

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Volume I contains "Jewish Doctors, Berlin Story, 1938" and "Mutilation, 1934," both of which appear in Shoah Train: Poems . The untitled poem on pp. 146-147 remains unpublished. Volume II contains, among others, drafts of "Decrees," "Track," "Star Song," and "Schnapps," all of which appear in Shoah Train .

did.unittitle: Langer, Lawrence. Admitting the Holocaust: Collected Essays

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of "Sound from Inside the Gas Chambers" and an early version of "Prayer" which is the first poem in Shoah Train .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of "Illumination Graft," which appeared in A Poetics of Hiroshima (2008), and an untitled poem.

did.unittitle: Levi, Primo. The Drowned and the Saved

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains a first draft of "Parity," which appears in Shoah Train .

did.unittitle: Levi, Primo. The Sixth Day and Other Tales

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains untitled poem fragments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains fragments of an unpublished essay.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The draft of an unfinished poem is visible on page 31.

did.unittitle: Longenbach, James. Wallace Stevens: The Plain Sense of Things

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of several poems including "Nesconset, AM," which appears in The Confessions of Doc Williams (2006).

did.unittitle: MacLeish, William H. The Day Before America: Changing the Nature of a Continent

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of poems that appeared in Crazy Horse in Stillness (1996). Two letters (dated 1989 and 1996), from William MacLeish to William Heyen, are laid in between the front cover and flyleaf.

did.unittitle: Malcolm, Norman. Ludwig Wittgenstein: A Memoir.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book holds the 1st draft of my poem "Wittgenstein," which appeared in The City Parables (1980).

did.unittitle: Mariani, Paul. William Carlos Williams: A New World Naked

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains a few first drafts of poems appearing in The Confessions of Doc Williams .

did.unittitle: Matthiessen, Peter. Nine-Headed Dragon River: Zen Journals

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An untitled poem appears on page 140.

did.unittitle: McKibben, Bill. Hope, Human and Wild

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains the first draft (p.7) of a yet unpublished poem, and the first draft of the poem that became "Subway" and appears in The Rope (2003).

did.unittitle: McPhee, John. Rising from the Plains

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of two poems that appeared in Crazy Horse in Stillness (1996) and a 3 x 5 card laid in with a draft of another poem.

did.unittitle: Melchior, Ib and Brandenburg, Frank. Quest: Searching for Germany's Nazi Past.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of "Swans" and "Bloodhound" which appear in Shoah Train .

did.unittitle: Messegue, Maurice. Of Men and Plants

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first draft of section XLVIII of Noise in the Trees (1974).

did.unittitle: Mitchell, John Hanson. Living at the End of Time.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first draft of the poem that became "Walden" which appears in The Rope (2003).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the 1st draft of "Epaulettes" which appeared in Crazy Horse in Stillness .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of many stanzas of "Iwo Dahlia," a poem appearing in A Poetics of Hiroshima & Other Poems .

did.unittitle: Niewyk, Donald L. Fresh Wounds: Early Narratives of Holocaust Survival

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of several poems appearing in Shoah Train .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains, among drafts of other poems, the first draft of "Castaneda," which appears in Pig Notes & Dumb Music (1998).

did.unittitle: Norton, M.D. Herter. Translations from the Poetry of Rainer Maria Rilke

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first draft of "Lament" that appears in Erika: Poems of the Holocaust .

did.unittitle: Nyiszli, Miklos. Auschwitz: A Doctor's Eyewitness Account

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains early drafts of several poems that appear in Shoah Train , including "Bread," "Auschwitz Reich Disfigured Haiku Sequence," "Luftpost," "The Pines," "Stones: the Efficacy of Poetry," "Ardor," and "Had."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of the poem that became "Communion Spoon" to be included in Shoah Train .

did.unittitle: Rabinowitz, Dorothy. New Lives: Survivors of the Holocaust Living in America

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first draft of "The Hair: Jacob Korman's Story" which appeared in Erika .

did.unittitle: Rees, Laurence. Auschwitz: A New History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains first drafts of "The Word," "The Carriages," "Exercise," "The Poet Laureate Speaks," "Poetry."

did.unittitle: Rosenberg, David. Ed. Testimony: Contemporary Writers Make the Holocaust Personal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of the poem that became "The Others," which appears in Shoah Train .

did.unittitle: Sakutaro, Hagiwara. Face at the Bottom of the World

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains drafts of the unpublished poem "Slug."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of several poems that appeared in Crazy Horse in Stillness (1996). "Aerial View, BC," "Ice," "Providence," "Friendlies," and "Libido Saloon."

did.unittitle: Schloegl, Irmgard. The Wisdom of the Zen Masters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The back flyleaf contains the 1st draft of a prose piece that appears in Pig Notes & Dumb Music: Prose on Poetry .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of a couple pieces in Pig Notes & Dumb Music: Prose on Poetry (1998).

did.unittitle: Selzer, Richard. Mortal Lessons: Notes on the Art of Surgery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First drafts of "The Dome" are written on back flyleaves. "The Dome" appears in The Confessions of Doc Williams & Other Poems (2006).

did.unittitle: Shapard, Robert and James Thomas. Sudden Fiction: American Short-Short Stories

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First drafts of "The Village," "Son" and "Grist" are in this book. These stories appear in The Hummingbird Corporation: Stories (2003).

did.unittitle: Sipper, Ralph. Modern First Editions, Cat. 54.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The last page here contains the first draft of my "Old Flame" that appears in The Hummingbird Corporation: Stories (2003).

did.unittitle: Stafford, Kim. Early Morning: Remembering My Father

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains poem fragements and an inlaid draft of a poem titled "Beginning with a line from William Stafford."

did.unittitle: Steinberg, Paul. Speak You Also: A Survivor's Reckoning

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains drafts of a couple poems including "Cabbage Steam."

did.unittitle: Stevens, John. One Robe, One Bowl: The Zen Poetry of Ryokan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Note by Heyen reads: "The poem on the back fly leaf became a Tamarack postcard." The book also contains inlaid notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains drafts of a poem on the back flyleaf. This book is inscribed by Stryk for Han and Bill Heyen on the title page

did.unittitle: Suzuki, Daisetz Teitaro. The Training of the Zen Buddhist Monk

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poem fragments are scattered throughout.

did.unittitle: Tall, Deborah. From Where We Stand: Recovering a Sense of Place

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Page 241 and the back flyleaf contain the beginnings of poems that, as Heyen notes, became poems from Crazy Horse in Stillness .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains drafts of unpublished poems and some notes on a pig note about the moon in the river that appeared in Pig Notes & Dumb Music .

did.unittitle: Teale, Edwin Way. A Naturalist Buys an Old Farm

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Laid in are the drafts of what never became a section of The Chestnut Rain , about a chestnut sill Teale mentions.

did.unittitle: Trevelyan, George and Belle Valerie Gaunt. A Tent in Which to Pass a Summer Night

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of "Easter Morning," which appeared in Shoah Train: Poems , and of the pig note that concludes Pig Notes & Dumb Music .

did.unittitle: Van Der Post, Laurens. The Voice of the Thunder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains two unpublished poem drafts.

did.unittitle: Wagner, Gottfried. Twilight of the Wagners: The Unveiling of a Family's Legacy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of the poems "Zeitpost," "Kindred Spirits," and "The Key" which will appear in Shoah Train .

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Heyen's responses are written on pages 99-100 and 208.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of 2-3 poems that appeared in Crazy Horse in Stillness (1996).

did.unittitle: Worth, C. Brooke. Of Mosquitoes, Moths, and Mice

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book contains the first drafts of the poem "Egg."

did.unittitle: Zassenhaus, Hiltgunt. Walls: Resisting the Third Reich—One Woman's Story

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: An unpublished poem is written on the back flyleaf.

did.unittitle: Zweig, Paul. Walt Whitman: the Making of the Poet

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This book's back flyleaves contain the first drafts of an unpublished poem Heyen spent many years revising: "The Fountain Pen: An Autobiography."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Included are bound copies of original journals held by the Rare Books and Special Collections, University of Rochester and which have been published as The Cabin: Journal 1964-1985, copies of which are also included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes material relating to a planned limited-edition book, A Poetics of Hiroshima: Two Poems by William Heyen & 12 Etchings by Robert Marx, to have been printed by Terence Chouniard at Wells College and under the imprint of The Black Bird Press, Marx's press with which he published collaborations with Daniel Berrigan, Elizabeth Bishop, Milton Kessler, and other poets. Material includes correspondence, manuscripts, proofs, and 17 etchings signed by Marx.

did.unittitle: Printed material, "Considering the Voluntary Absence of God"
A Poetics of Hiroshima with Marx etchings
